Organs/Tissues: Flexible for small-volume flow culture (e.g. liver cells, kidney cells, endothelium, 3D constructs)
Physiological/Pathological: Both (user can create normal physiology or add pathology/inflammation/tumor)
Cell Source: Any user-provided cells (primary, lines, iPSC) or small organoids/tissue slices
Stromal Cells: Yes, if co-cultured (fibroblasts, mesenchyme) as desired
Tissue-resident Immune: Yes, if included by user (e.g. Kupffer cells in liver)
Circulating Immune: Yes (immune cells can be perfused in loop)
Crosstalk (Multi-tissue): Yes (connect multiple QV500 chambers in series)
Notable Features: Small ~500µL chamber; gentle pump-driven flow for improved viability
Plate/Format (Throughput): Standalone silicone chambers + tubing + reservoir (low–medium throughput)
Max Culture Duration: Days to weeks (extends primary cell function)
Readouts - Live Imaging: Possible with coverslip inserts or partial transparency
Readouts - Cell Retrieval: Yes, open chamber to harvest cells/scaffold
Readouts - Whole Tissue: Yes, can fix or remove 3D constructs for histology
Readouts - TEER: No built-in, typically not a barrier format
Readouts - Integrated Biosensors: No, external sensors can be added in reservoir/tubing
Real-time Microenvironment Control: Flow rate adjustable, add drugs to reservoir

Organs/Tissues: Barrier/ALI or liquid-liquid interface (e.g. lung epithelium, skin, gut inserts)
Cell Source: Cells on Transwell inserts (e.g. lung epithelial, intestinal barrier, skin tissue)
Stromal Cells: Yes if placed beneath epithelium in 3D or in same circuit
Tissue-resident Immune: Optional (e.g. alveolar macrophages in lung ALI)
Circulating Immune: Yes (immune cells can be flowed in basolateral circuit)
Crosstalk (Multi-tissue): Yes, multiple QV600 or combined with QV500
Air-Liquid Interface: Yes (lung, skin) or liquid-liquid for others
3D Scaffold: Yes (tissue constructs on membrane or in separate compartment)
Notable Features: Supports ALI for lung or layered tissues, dedicated for barrier culture under flow
Plate/Format (Throughput): Individual chamber holding an insert, low–medium throughput
Max Culture Duration: Days to weeks, fosters differentiation (ciliation, mucus)
Readouts - Live Imaging: Yes (remove insert or view in-chamber if transparent)
Readouts - TEER: Yes (possible with standard electrodes across insert)
Gas Mix Controlled: Incubator, ALI on top if needed
Real-time Microenvironment Control: Flow adjustable, user can add stimuli, measure TEER periodically

Organs/Tissues: Larger-volume optical tray with 6 chambers (3D tissues, multi-organ co-culture)
Cell Source: Any cell type, organoids, small tissue slices, scaffolds in each chamber
Multiple Cell Types: Yes, can place co-cultures or link multiple chambers for multi-tissue
Tissue-resident Immune: Yes if present in tissue (e.g. macrophages in infection model)
Circulating Immune: Yes, if introduced in flow circuit
Crosstalk (Multi-tissue): Yes, can link up to 6 chambers in series or parallel
Extracellular Matrix: Yes, can embed 3D scaffolds or spheroids with ECM
3D Scaffold: Yes, QV900 designed for 3D tissue constructs + imaging
Notable Features: Optical tray for live imaging in 6-chamber format, gently perfused system
Max Culture Duration: Days to weeks, extended viability for chronic experiments
Readouts - Cell Retrieval: Yes, can open chamber or remove scaffold
Readouts - Whole Tissue: Yes, fix entire 3D tissue or do histology
Readouts - TEER: Not standard, not a barrier device
Real-time Microenvironment Control: Flow rate adjustable, add compounds. No built-in sensors
model_availability: Product (QV900 for multi-3D tissue or infection models)
